# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NAME  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 170, 250]]<|/det|>
CENTRE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 214, 425, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|>
CANDIDATE NUMBER  

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[735, 214, 905, 255]]<|/det|>  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 230, 292]]<|/det|>
## MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 210, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0580/12  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[732, 303, 905, 318]]<|/det|>
February/March 2024  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[860, 327, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
1 hour  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 395, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 400, 400]]<|/det|>
You will need: Geometrical instruments  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 222, 433]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 280, 450]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 450, 760, 466]]<|/det|>
Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 466, 806, 482]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 482, 562, 497]]<|/det|>
Write your answer to each question in the space provided.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 498, 480, 512]]<|/det|>
Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 513, 359, 527]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 528, 480, 543]]<|/det|>
You should use a calculator where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 333, 558]]<|/det|>
You may use tracing paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 467, 574]]<|/det|>
You must show all necessary working clearly.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 574, 855, 604]]<|/det|>
Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 605, 485, 619]]<|/det|>
For \(\pi\) , use either your calculator value or 3.142.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 212, 665]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 667, 384, 682]]<|/det|>
The total mark for this paper is 56.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 682, 729, 698]]<|/det|>
The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 636, 120]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 287, 631, 306]]<|/det|>
From this list of numbers, write down all the multiples of 11.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[640, 350, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<form>.................................................... [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 381, 146, 400]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 381, 789, 400]]<|/det|>
Zaid has a non-calculator method for working out if a number is a multiple of 11.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 517, 415]]<|/det|>
He shows his method for the number 919281.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 432, 841, 452]]<|/det|>
Subtract and add alternately the digits in the number. \(9 - 1 + 9 - 2 + 8 - 1 = 22\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 467, 838, 486]]<|/det|>
Check if the answer is a multiple of 11. \(22 = 2 \times 11\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 501, 636, 520]]<|/det|>
As 22 is a multiple of 11 then 919281 is a multiple of 11.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 543, 769, 562]]<|/det|>
Show that the number 918271937 is a multiple of 11 by using Zaid's method.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 670, 920, 688]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]
